result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DATES:

AMENDED: No contact with victim(s):  M.B.J. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Case Called: 9:31 am
Clerk: Kassidi. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall for ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jessica Phelps in person.
VRCW.
Testifier Jessica Allen sworn and testifies-Identifies Defendant.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY.
Dates set: Pretrial Conference 07/14/2022 @ 11:10 am
Bond: Continued.

Atty Phelps is requesting that the Court address bond at this time.
State has no objection to the Court proceeding with bond hearing at this time.
Atty Phelps makes requests to the Court and makes arguments. State does not take a position on the ATTIC removal request due to it being a Level 1. 
State makes arguments on other requests. Court addresses the parties and makes findings.
